Description: In the annexed Crimea, the cat Musya was rescued, which a tourist threw into the water from a 40-meter cliffThis required the help of climbers - the cat swam out and hid in a crevice at a 10-meter height. Now she has been handed over to veterinarians.On February 23, a 24-year-old tourist from St. Petersburg threw a cat named Musya from a cliff near the Swallow's Nest castle in Yalta. Musya was a local attraction and lived on the territory of the complex for about ten years, becoming, according to social network users, a favorite of both local residents and tourists.As can be seen in the video recordings, the suspect in animal cruelty approached the cat, petted it, and then, making sure that there were no witnesses, took it to the observation deck and threw it off a 40-meter cliff. After the arrest, he explained that he threw the cat away because it began to struggle when he picked it up. At the same time, he could not explain why he did not release the animal, but threw it off a cliff. A criminal case was opened against the detainee under Article 245 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation -Cruelty to Animals.- According to this article, such a crime is punishable by imprisonment for up to three years.

Description: The 17-year-old son of a mobilized man was detained in Bashkiria, allegedly collecting data about the Ryazan oil refinerySecurity forces detained a 17-year-old teenager in Bashkiria, whose father was mobilized in 2022. After entering the university in 2024, he posted ads in chat rooms looking for part-time work, where he was found and recruited by Ukrainian curators. As the young man said during interrogation, he was asked for money to paint graffiti, remove religious clothing from a woman (as a result, he made a staged video), and take photos of mosques. -During the New Year holidays, he invited me to go to Ryazan, shoot a video of the oil refinery and show the location on the map of the perimeter, communication towers, security posts and air defense. I accepted the offer and went to Ryazan. Having sent him 5-7 photos, I completed the work, he gave me an amount of around 65 thousand rubles. Afterwards he asked me to go to Kazan, I asked my friend, she went with me. We took photos of a kindergarten, a parking space, a hostel and a church. After which he paid us an amount of around 50 thousand rubles,- said the teenager. -He asked to find a person who could set fire to the locomotive. I wrote to a specialized Telegram channel about finding such people. I don‚Äôt know what else, because the next day I was brilliantly detained by law enforcement officers. -I really regret what I did, because I committed a crime and involved other people in it, which is currently unacceptable,- he added. Now the detainee is being checked under articles of terrorism and treason, he faces up to 20 years in prison.The day before, the Ryazan oil refinery was attacked for the third time since the beginning of 2025.

Title: üñº After returning from the war in Ukraine, veterans killed at le...
Description: After returning from the war in Ukraine, -veterans- killed at least 240 people in Russian regionsOn the third anniversary of Russia‚Äôs full-scale invasion of Ukraine, journalists from the publication -7x7- conducted an analysis of judicial statistics and establishedthat combatants returning from the front were involved in the murder of at least 240 people in various regions of the Russian Federation. The study covers sentences under five articles of the Criminal Code related to murder handed down between 2022 and 2025. However, given that some cases are still pending and detailed data is not available for a number of convictions, the actual number of victims may be higher. According to the study, Russian courts handed down 225 verdicts in cases of murders committed by former combatants in Ukraine. The geography of crimes covers 62 regions of the country. The largest number of victims was recorded in the Krasnodar Territory and the Kostroma Region - 14 people in each region. In the Rostov region, 12 people died at the hands of those returning from the war, in the Trans-Baikal Territory - 10, in the Krasnoyarsk Territory - 9. In the Volgograd and Perm regions, 8 victims were registered each. The victims of these crimes are not only relatives or acquaintances of former military personnel, but also random people: children, pensioners, passers-by. In some cases, the defendants are charged with additional charges related to rape and robbery. Courts often consider participation in hostilities on the territory of Ukraine as a mitigating circumstance, and awards and certificates received at the front as a positive characteristic of the defendant‚Äôs personality.

Title: üñº Since the start of the war in Russia, the number of political ...
Description: Since the start of the war in Russia, the number of political persecutions has almost doubled - report Avtozak LiveFrom 2022 to 2024, the number of political persecutions in Russia almost doubled - from 1265 to 2373 cases. At the same time, the average time for consideration of politically motivated cases has also decreased significantly, the Avtozak Live team found out.According to their data, from February 24, 2022 to February 9, 2025, more than 5,400 politically motivated criminal cases were initiated under 146 articles of the criminal code against 5,254 people, at least 2,940 of whom are now in custody. In more than 1,900 cases, cases against the persecuted were initiated under two or more articles. The most charges - 16 - were brought against Andrei Pronsky, who is accused of preparing an attempt on the life of Vladimir Solovyov. The remaining nine defendants in this case are charged with 15 articles each.One of the most common articles for political persecution in Russia is Article 205 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (-Terrorist Act-). Description: A measles outbreak in Texas and New Mexico amid the growing popularity of the anti-vaccination movement - almost 100 cases90 cases of infection have been confirmed in Texas, nine in New Mexico. The highest number of cases is in Gaines County, where the vaccination rate is below the state average.The outbreak began in the South Plains region of Texas in late January, the state Department of Health Services said. According to the latest data, among the 90 cases, 77 are children. 16 people are hospitalized.In New Mexico, infections were reported in Lee County, which borders the epicenter of the outbreak in Texas, the local Department of Health said. Nine people fell ill there, including four children.Local services are urgently setting up additional vaccination and testing points to contain the spread of infection. Free vaccinations are available in Seminole (Gaines County, Texas) and Lee County (New Mexico). Additional testing sites have also opened in these areas.Measles is considered one of the most contagious infections, and outbreaks occur when herd immunity levels fall below 95%. In Gaines County, the rate is significantly lower: last year, only 82% of children received the two required doses of the MMR (measles, mumps, rubella) vaccine.Vaccine refusal rates are on the rise in the region. In Texas, the law allows for -conscientious objection- to vaccinate a child, and in Gaines County, 13% of students exercised this right.The situation is complicated by the appointment of Robert Kennedy Jr. as Secretary of Health. Kennedy is known to be skeptical of vaccines and cited controversial studies about their possible side effects. He has already stated that he intends to review the childhood vaccination system.In the United States, measles was officially considered eliminated, but due to a decrease in the level of vaccination, cases of the disease are being recorded more and more often. In 2024, the country reported 285 cases of measles in more than 30 states.

Description: For refusing to buy a UAV with his own money, a soldier was kidnapped, shot with a pneumatic gun and wanted to be -zeroed.- His relatives are still looking for himThe girlfriend of Denis Mashlyakevich, a 35-year-old soldier of the 150th Division of the 68th Tank Regiment, born in 1989, contacted the ASTRA editorial office. There, 200 thousand rubles were withdrawn from his account, which is confirmed by a bank statement.Then the serviceman was illegally detained somewhere in the -DPR-, shot in both hands with a pneumatic weapon and his phone was taken away. One bullet got stuck in his right hand, which led to problems with his fingers - pain and limited mobility.During this period, several large debits were made from his accounts: three payments of 305,970 rubles and another in the amount of 81,592 rubles. The recipient of the payment is a certain -Azamat B.-After these events, one of Denis‚Äôs colleagues warned him that they wanted to -nullify- him‚Äîto remove him as an unnecessary witness. Then messages began to arrive that Denis was being -taken away-, that he was -going there-, they wrote that he was on the front line somewhere wearing arm guards. Since then there has been no contact with Denis,- says the girlfriend of the missing serviceman.The relatives demand a fair trial and punishment for the perpetrators, but all requests are answered with replies. Title: üñº A resident of Cherepovets was denied an abortion in all medica...
Description: A resident of Cherepovets was denied an abortion in all medical institutions in the city A 38-year-old resident of Cherepovets, Natalya (name changed), was denied an abortion in antenatal clinics in the city, as well as in private clinics in Cherepovets and Vologda. According to the woman, medical institutions in the region actually stopped providing this service without official explanation. -I live in the Cherepovets region, I have three children, my youngest daughter is three years old. I planned to go to work, but found out I was pregnant. I contacted a doctor at my place of residence, but I was told that he was not responsible for performing abortions. In a private clinic they did an ultrasound, set the period at eight weeks and explained that medical termination of pregnancy at this stage is no longer possible,- Natalya told the Rech newspaper. After this, the woman tried to sign up for an operation at the city maternity hospital, but was refused. -Yesterday was the last day we performed abortions. From today we have no right,- they told her over the phone.She received a similar answer in other antenatal clinics in the city. During a personal visit to one of the consultations, Natalia was explained that at the regional level a decision had been made to recommend that all women under 50 years of age continue pregnancy. However, she was not provided with any official documents, and she was not given a written refusal to have an abortion. Later, the woman turned to the official community of the maternity hospital on the social network VKontakte with a request to explain the reasons for the refusal. In response, she was informed that -termination of pregnancy is carried out only for medical reasons in a 24-hour hospital- and that this issue is regulated at the level of the government of the Vologda region. The couple considered the possibility of leaving the child, but came to the conclusion that they would not be able to provide for him morally and financially. -My husband already works three jobs. I spent ten years on maternity leave, and now I wanted to return to my professional activities,- explained Natalya. As a result, the woman had to go to a private clinic in the Yaroslavl region, where they agreed to carry out the operation without restrictions. The cost of the procedure was about nine thousand rubles.

Description: A monument to Stalin will not be erected in Kaliningrad because of his repressions and terror The head of the Kaliningrad administration, Elena Dyatlova, rejected the proposal of the local branch of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation to erect a monument to Joseph Stalin, citing historical documents condemning the cult of personality and political repression. In a response published on the party‚Äôs website, Dyatlova noted that the installation of monuments should not lead to conflicts in society, and recalled the 1956 resolution of the CPSU Central Committee -On overcoming the cult of personality and its consequences,- as well as the law -On the rehabilitation of victims of political repression.- She emphasized that the period from the 1930s to the early 1950s is recognized as the time of Stalinist repressions, and many years of terror and persecution of citizens of the USSR were condemned as incompatible with the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãlaw and justice.The Communist Party of the Russian Federation called Dyatlova‚Äôs position -a clear anti-Soviet position aimed at denigrating Soviet history and the great feat of the people.- The head of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation faction in the Legislative Assembly of the Kaliningrad Region, Maxim Bulanov, said that, in his opinion, the mayor is trying to whitewash his incompetence and inaction, which led to the deplorable state of the city. He emphasized that the party will not allow history to be rewritten and evaded responsibility.In recent years, monuments to Stalin have been erected regularly in Russia. These include busts and full-length monuments. In November-December 2024 alone, three monuments to Stalin were erected - in the Primorsky Territory, in North Ossetia and in the Vologda region. There are more than a hundred of them in total.Elena Dyatlova has held the post of mayor of Kaliningrad since November 2020 and at the same time heads the city branch of the United Russia party.

Description: Hamas handed over the bodies of four hostages to Israel. Among them are children who have become a symbol of the war in IsraelThe bodies of 33-year-old Shiri Bibas, her sons - five-year-old Ariel and two-year-old Kfir, as well as 83-year-old Oded Lifshitz were handed over to representatives of the International Committee of the Red Cross in the south of the Gaza Strip, in the Khan Yunis area, reports The Jerusalem Post. After his release, he said that he had no information about the fate of his wife and children. The transfer of bodies was accompanied by a propaganda campaign on the part of Hamas. The militants set up a stage with posters depicting the dead hostages and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as a vampire. Next to the coffins, covered with Israeli flags, were the inscriptions: -A war criminal killed them with missiles from his fighters- and -Return to war - return of those abducted in coffins.- The deceased Oded Lifshitz was a famous journalist and peaceful activist, one of the founders of Kibbutz Nir-Oz. He dedicated his life to helping others, including transporting sick Gazans to Israeli hospitals. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called the day a -day of turmoil and sorrow- for the country and stressed that Israel was determined to prevent similar tragedies from happening in the future. After the transfer, the bodies were taken to the Institute of Forensic Medicine in Abu Kabir for official identification and determination of the cause. death.

Description: ASTRA: The UK is ready to send troops to Ukraine to monitor compliance with any peace agreement, the country's Prime Minister, in an interview with The Telegraph, Keir Starmer, said that the country is -ready to play a leading role in accelerating work on security guarantees... It's time for Europe to take more responsibility for security, - StarmerBritish Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that European countries should be more involved in ensuring the security of the continent, since the United States expects a greater contribution from them. He said this after a meeting of European leaders organized by French President Emmanuel Macron. -We are in a new era, and it is time for us to recognize that we cannot endlessly cling to the comforts of the past. Europe must take greater responsibility for its own security,- Starmer stressed. He noted that Washington does not plan to leave NATO, but the issue of -burden sharing- is becoming more pressing. -President Trump has long said that Europe must do more. We Europeans must take these signals seriously and rise to new challenges,- the Prime Minister said. Starmer confirmed that Great Britain is ready to consider the possibility of sending its military to Ukraine if a peace agreement is concluded, but stressed that without guarantees from the United States such steps will not give the desired result. Previously, Washington ruled out the possibility of sending its own troops to Ukraine-Only American security guarantees can effectively deter Russia from new aggression,- he noted. Starmer also said he would soon travel to Washington for talks with Donald Trump to discuss key elements of a possible peace deal for Ukraine and further security cooperation.

Description: ASTRA: High-ranking representatives of the Russian Federation and the United States may meet next week in Saudi Arabia to agree on negotiations between Putin and Trump. Ukraine will not take part in the negotiations between Russia and the United States, - ZelenskyUkrainian President Vladimir Zelensky said that Ukraine will not participate in the negotiations between Russia and the United States, which will take place in Saudi Arabia on February 18. In an interview with Politico, Zelensky stressed that Kyiv was not informed of plans for negotiations and that his visit to the region was planned long before the US proposed to meet with Russia in Riyadh.-Ukraine will not participate in these negotiations. We did not know about them, and my visit to the region was planned long ago, before the United States decided to meet with Russia here,- the president said.Zelensky added that negotiations without the participation of Ukraine will not lead to results. He also noted that on the day of the start of negotiations with the United States and Russia in Saudi Arabia, he will be in Turkey, and will arrive in Saudi Arabia the next day. -My visits have nothing to do with these negotiations. However, when I arrive in Saudi Arabia, I will ask His Majesty what he knows about the topics of the negotiations,- the president added.Zelensky expressed support for the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãincluding European leaders in the negotiation process and noted that any negotiations should be aimed at providing real security guarantees for Ukraine and putting pressure on Russia to achieve peace.
